titles: The chearful husband: or, The despairng [sic] wife. In a dialogue between a loving couple, about the cares and crosses of these troublesome times. To the tune of, The jealous lover.
publisher: Printed for J. Blare, at the Looking-glass on London bridge,
notes: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Sweet kind and loving husband dear ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
